intro: Hesperolinon tehamense, commonly known as the Tehama hesperolinon, is a rare flowering plant native to the Tehama region of California. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks and in forest understories. Its flowers are small and white, with a delicate structure that supports pollination by insects. Hesperolinon tehamense is of particular interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological adaptations.
